summary: A series of emails from June-July 2019 among FBI and possibly other officials coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case. The emails show scheduling attempts, mention of a meeting at SDNY, and an ADIC-requested case brief.

connections.description: Both are copied on FBI emails coordinating a conference call about Epstein victim interviews, indicating they work together or in related units.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: A conference call was set up for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case, involving FBI personnel from the Violent Crimes Task Force and Victim Services Division.

events.title: ADIC-requested case brief
events.description: The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case brief at 3:30 PM, leading to a hard stop at 3:20 PM for other meetings.

events.title: Meeting at SDNY
events.description: A 2:30 meeting was mentioned with an unnamed individual and his team on a wider variety of subjects at the Southern District of New York (SDNY).

locations: FBI NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force
FBI Victim Services Division Child Victim Services Unit
keyFacts: FBI officials were actively coordinating in June-July 2019 to conduct victim interviews in the Epstein case.
The conference call involved the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force and Child Victim Services Unit, indicating a multi-disciplinary approach.
An ADIC-requested case brief on July 1, 2019, suggests high-level oversight of the Epstein investigation.
A meeting at SDNY was mentioned, indicating coordination between federal investigators and prosecutors.
The emails show careful scheduling and security considerations (unclassified conference call with passcode).
